Award.AwardTitle: AG15: SIAM Conference on Applied Algebraic Geometry
Award.AbstractNarration:
The award will be used to support travel of students and early career researchers to the 2015 Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics (SIAM) Conference on Applied Algebraic Geometry, to be held at the National Institute for Mathematical Sciences (NIMS) and at the Korean Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST) in Daejeon, South Korea on August 3-7, 2015. This is the biennial conference of the SIAM Activity Group on Algebraic Geometry. The SIAM activity group was founded in 2009 and the SIAM Conference on Applied Algebraic Geometry has quickly grown to be the premier conference on applications of algebraic geometry. This conference presents a significant opportunity to establish new connections and collaborations with the algebraic geometry community in Asia. The meeting promises to have a significant impact on the growth of Applied Algebraic Geometry, and the conference offers a unique opportunity for students and early career researchers.

The 2015 SIAM Conference on Applied Algebraic Geometry will continue the tradition of covering a very wide range of topics in applied algebraic geometry. "Algebraic Geometry" is interpreted broadly to include at least: algebraic geometry, commutative algebra, noncommutative algebra, symbolic and numeric computation, algebraic and geometric combinatorics, representation theory, and algebraic topology. The conference will include more than 60 minisymposium sessions with approximately 250 invited talks, and 9 plenary addresses given by internationally renowned experts. The conference is a satellite of the International Congress on Industrial and Applied Mathematics (ICIAM 2015) to be held in Beijing on the following week, so the participants will have an opportunity to attend both conferences. The conference website is http://camp.nims.re.kr/activities/eventpages/?id=200&action=overview

POR.DRECONTENT:
The grant was used to support the travel of 22 early career reserachers to the 2015 SIAM Conference on Aplied Algebraic geometry. The supported group consisted of 9 graduate students, 9 postdocs and 3 assistant professors and included 7 female participants. The supported participants delivered 23 presentations at the SIAM AG15 conference. Additionally, one postdoc was supported in attending Applied Algebra Days III held at the University of Wisconsin, Madison, April 29-May 1, 2016.

Intellectual Merit:

The SIAM AG15 conference presented a unique opportunity for early careers researchers. The conference covered a very broad variety of topics in applied algebraic geometry, including statistics, computer vision, tensor decomposition, complexity theory, application in biology and physics, algebraic techniques in optimization, symbolic and numerical computation, economics,  coding theory and cryptography. With such a broad range of topics and a fantastic lineup of plenary speakers the conference was an important one for early career researchers. There were a total of 259 participants including 9 invited speakers, 220 minisymposium speakers and 9 contributed talks representing 30 countries.

Broader Impact:

The conference presented a rare opportunity to build ties with applied algebraic community in Asia. SIAM AG15 was a satelite conference of International Congress on Industrial and Applied Mathematics (ICIAM 15) held in Beijing and some participants attended both conferences. 

The supported participants delivered 23 presentations at the conference. The early career participants were able to deliver presentations in front of world renowned experts in mathematics and other disciplines. The conference gave early career reseachers a unique opportunity to broadly disseminate theor research and see the latest developments and new directions in applied algebraic geometry
